attributes.action: tackle the problem of excessive drinking in the UK and not punish the majority who drink responsibly
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We urge the Prime Minister to recognise drinking patterns in the UK are in decline.

1         Average alcohol consumption in the UK is falling 
• Per capita alcohol consumption has been falling since 2003
• The UK ranks 13th out of 27 in the EU league table of per capita alcohol consumption

2  The numbers drinking over the recommended weekly guidelines fell between 2000 and 2006      
o Men – down from 29% to 23%
o Women – down from 17% to 12%
• In the UK 7% of the population drink 33% of the alcohol

3  Underage drinking is down from 26% of 11-15 year olds in 2001 to 21% in 2006
• The numbers of 11-15 year olds who have never drunk alcohol are increasing:
o 2000 – 40%
o 2006 – 46%

4  Number of people reporting binge drinking (over 8 units) on at least one day in previous week is down:
o Men – 2003/4 – 23%
      2006 – 18%
o Women – 2003/4 – 9%
2006 - 8%

5 The laws we have to tackle alcohol misuse are not being enforced
• Just 2 people have been prosecuted and one found guilty of selling alcohol to a drunken person since the 2003 Licensing Act was introduced
